TopicTitle: Who I think should play the Doctor after Peter Capaldi

Articles.Content:
I've got two candidates for the thirteenth... fourteenth... fifteenth... second-second... whatever-the-heckth Doctor.

One is a very popular candidate: Benedict Cumberbatch. As most BBC fans know, he played in the series "Sherlock" as the one and only Sherlock Holmes. Personally, I think he would make an excellent Doctor. He reminds me a lot of the fourth Doctor.

My second candidate, who I'll bet very few of you have ever even heard of, is Rene Auberjonois. Rene played in Star Trek: Deep Space Nine as Odo, the shape-shifting head of security on station DS-9.
Sorry for a large photo. I think he would be pretty good dressed up as this. I don't think that Rene Auberjonois would make a good doctor,too old.
let sir patrick stewart be the doctor.

let sir patrick stewart be the doctor.

Again,too old.
I thought that the doctor can only regenerate 12 times?

I thought that the doctor can only regenerate 12 times?

Well, you see. (Spoiler in White) Because of, well, needing more shows he got them from the dead timelords. Because there was a crack in reality. On a planet identified as Galifrey

As for a future Doctor, I second Patrick Stewart.

As for a future Doctor, I second Patrick Stewart.

I would also like to see this.

"Companion, set a course for poosh, timewarp factor 6, engage!"

Personally it's a no for Stewart and Cumberbatch. Way to big actors.

Playing the Doctor is a role that typecast you. You can't typecast those two.

I was suprised when there was no topic on this movie/episode.

My reactions were basically, in order:

FREE THE TIMELORDS

The doctor can age?

Crud so this is how the doctor dies...

Whoah, crack thing! Time regneration!

Wonder who the new doctor is... I will miss ma- WHOAH HE'S THE SAME!

Oh, it's only going slowly...

Wait. This guy? Old guy? ???

Can we let the guy be in a couple episodes before we replace him?

Personally I hope we get another TomBakeresque run where the guy lasts like 7-8 seasons.
Imagine if Craig Ferguson was the Doctor. Good lord.
